content.description: Steep face climb leads past 2 bolts to a small ledge system.  Step right and climb through the handcrack roof section past 3 bolts to easier ground above.  You can slot a piece between the last bolt and the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts, yellow alien size piece(optional), 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the sport line with a roof crack in the middle of the steep ampitheatre right of Crown of Thorns.

content.description: The middle or left crack seem to be the best start to this route.  Thenmove up and left on some slippery moss.  Fire the thin crack in the dihedral, heading up and left after towards the tree on top.
content.location: Near the right end of the Down Under Wall.  3 cracks lead up and left to a thin left facing dihedral crack.

content.description: Climb the slab, starting a little left of the boulder at the top. Traverse right beneath the bolt, then head up below the boulder. Surmount the boulder via the sweet handcrack, the best part of this route. Good rock.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear to 2.5". Rap off tree.
content.location: Left around the corner from Crown of Thorns. Start beneath the boulder at the top with the crack splitting it.

content.description: The obvious roof with a large chimney to its left. Start on the right of the green, licheny face and trend left at the third bolt to some technical, reachy moves below the lip. Find the jugs over the roof, clip, and navigate to the anchor.
Face climb on good rock up and a little left, past four bolts, to the thin crack system at the top.  There may be a little lichen at the top, but it's all good.
content.protection: 4 bolts, gear to .75".  Rap off trees or hike to the top of any routes close by that have bolted anchors.
content.location: Near the right end of the Down Under Wall.  From the large black dihedral, this line is maybe 15-20 feet left.  Make sure you are on the line that heads up and a little left towards a thin crack system at the top.  There is a new bolted line right of Pentecost and I don't know what it is.

content.description: Sweet.  Awesome steep well protected climbing heading up and left through a roof, then straight up to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  The left bolt in the roof is has a loose hanger and is unneccessary as it is 6 inches away from the right bolt.
content.location: This is the left most route in the Down Under area, right before the walkdown area.  It is the steep orange face.

content.description: Starting in the small cave, climb the steep handcrack over the bulge. After that, continue up in the dihedral offwidth. Great rock.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5". Rap off tree at the top of the route.  New guide is showing bolts to the left at the top, just over the lip.
content.location: Left of the large overhung area on the right end of the Down Under Wall.

content.description: This area has a good mix of face and crack, sport and trad.  Most of the routes here are 10s and up.  Good rock, though.
